TopicTitle: Can my game look like this again?

Articles.Content:
Back in 0.25, my game looked like this: 

 How can i have this same look in 1.0.5?
If you  mean the planets, there are plenty of environmental mods that add stuff like that.

Just now, Choctofliatrio2.0 said:

If you  mean the planets, there are plenty of environmental mods that add stuff like that.

 Yes, and in fact i'm using Realistic Atmospheres and Planetshine, but the results are not as good as it was with 0.25.

14 minutes ago, Audioslavez said:

 Yes, and in fact i'm using Realistic Atmospheres and Planetshine, but the results are not as good as it was with 0.25.

 

Realistic Atmospheres only adjusts the physical parameters of atmospheric bodies (atmo height, pressure, drag, heating). It doesn't do anything for eye candy. 

If you want good-looking planets with clouds and such, then you want Environmental Visual Enhancements. 

In my experience PlanetShine works great in 1.0.5

Just now, FullMetalMachinist said:

Realistic Atmospheres only adjusts the physical parameters of atmospheric bodies (atmo height, pressure, drag, heating). It doesn't do anything for eye candy. 

If you want good-looking planets with clouds and such, then you want Environmental Visual Enhancements. 

In my experience PlanetShine works great in 1.0.5

Alright, i'll try this, thanks

Also try Scatterer. Not helpful when your computer doesn't like over 100 parts but it looks good.

The mods you have installed there are clearly EVE and Scatterer, but for better looks try Stock Visual Enhancements which is an add on.
+1 for Scatterer. It is comatible (to some point) with EVE. And it does have ocean shaders!
I find that using Scatterer, Stock Visual Enhancements, Planet Shine, a new sky box and new sun glare, KSP looks as pretty as ever. Thanks for the creators making all of this possible!
I think the the missing piece of the puzzle is Better Atmospheres, but sadly, it seems to have fallen by the wayside.  No other mod came close to producing the same visuals it did.
Scatterer seems promising, donwloading it now.
